titleStmt.title: J. W. Bingham et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10986

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

Your petitioners John Gore and John. W. Bingham would respectfully represent to your Excellency that on Samuel Matheney was fined in the police Court of Harrodsburg the sum of five Dollars & costs, amounting in all to the sum of Nine dollars & 58 cents, and that your petitioners became security upon a Replevin bond for the said Matheney, for the amount of the aforesaid fine -- and costs; and that since the execution of the aforesaid bond said Matheny has left for the southern ^the^ Army, and an execution has been issued against your petitioners for the said fine and costs, and is now in the hands of the Marshal, and your petitioners will have to pay the same -- and that they have no funds in their hands belonging to the said Matheney, & that should they discharge said execution, it will be a total loss to your petitioners.

Wherefore your petitioners would pray your Excellency to interpose in their behalf and remit said fine
an as in duty bound your petitioners will ever pray.
John Gore and John W. Bingham say that the statements contained in the foregoing petition are true.
Sworn to before me this 18 day of Nov 1861.
E. J. Polk Examiner for Mercer County
The undersigned ^citizens of Harrodsburg^ join in the prayer of the above petition

Names
Chr Chinn
E J Polk
Q A Thompson
J. W. Cardwell
S S McFatridge
William Daveiss
J. L. Smedley
J M S Mara
W A Hode
Names

$5 } Replevin Bond
John Gore
J. W. Bingham
Issd Nov 19. 1861
